content.question: Let <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></math> be the region in the first quadrant bounded by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, 2 x plus 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the graph of <math alttext="y equals, x plus 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the vertical line <math alttext="x equals 4 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the volume of the solid generated when region <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></math> is revolved about the horizontal line <math alttext="y equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 8.12: Volume with Washer Method - Revolving Around Other Axes

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
